If we track the turn actions shown on the website, we can see they don't match up with those in the .csv file. Just to re-iterate what the website showed the game_events for turn 3 to be:

* Chaos Magicians: burn 2. action act6. transform c5. transform b6. build c5
* Swarmlings: build c1
* Dwarves: send p to earth

What's going on here? Currently I trust the website's sequence of events more, as they logically follow a sequence and can be mapped from move to move.

This is an open Notebook to explore how to make sense of the game_events.csv. From what I can see, information about what turn a move was taken is incorrect therefore not possible to use to get more in-depth stats/train an ML model. Let me know if what I'm doing is incorrect, it doesn't make sense that turn information is incorrect if this is the data used by the game to remember the correct state from turn to turn, as the game itself doesn't seem to show many problems with remembering states.

I'm going to use an example from the game, "jsnell19" (https://terra.snellman.net/game/jsnell19), using round 2 data (as round 1 data includes game set-up). Let's focus on turn 3 as it starts getting a bit more simple, then:
